<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_get_timestamp:
```c
unsigned long long metal_get_timestamp(void)
{
	unsigned long long t = 0;
	struct timespec tp;
	int r;

	r = clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC, &tp);
	if (r == -1) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "clock_gettime failed!\n");
		return t;
	}
	t = tp.tv_sec * (NS_PER_S);
	t += tp.tv_nsec;

	return t;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I have listed all occurrences of function calls in this function body; these are the only expressions that could produce direct or indirect calls back into metal_get_timestamp. Other lines do not perform function calls and therefore cannot cause recursion: variable declarations (unsigned long long t = 0; struct timespec tp; int r;), the arithmetic assignments (t = tp.tv_sec * (NS_PER_S); t += tp.tv_nsec;), the return statements, and the use of identifiers/constants such as CLOCK_MONOTONIC and NS_PER_S (they are constants/macros, not function calls in this context). There are no function-pointer dereferences or other call sites in the provided code fragment that would need investigation.
